text: For tourists like myself, this place was a godsend!! I had not eaten a real meal(instead consuming fast food, chips, and alcohol) in three days and my first bite of the BBQ beef combination was amazing! I really liked the macaroni salad and the dressing for the salad. Definitely better than all the fast food around and way cheaper( and tastier) than anything on the strip

This is a hidden gem in VEGAS! Food is always fantastic, hot, and fresh. I recommend the sushi rolls (I haven't had the raw fish...but the tempura and California rolls, and shrimp crunch roll have always been great), Teriyaki chicken and beef, pasta salad, and of course their house salad dressing. 

Enjoy!
Absolutely love the bento box. Always consistently great. The katsu and chicken teriyaki are my favorite.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! :)  Food is delicious and affordable!  There's a wide range of variety on menu and I believe most items are below $10! This is a casual/fast food restaurant...I guess its mainly for take-out/delivery! The restaurant itself is pretty small... There's like 6-7 tables total. I had a salad with strawberry guava juice today. CHICKEN MANGO AVOCADO SALAD WITH CHICKEN IS MY FAV!!! The order comes with salad and miso soup. I love the salad dressing and the chicken tastes like teriyaki/BBQ. It adds protein to the salad and the mango is so sweet =) Orders are ready in like 5 min and the cashier is very friendly. He interacts with customers and he always makes my order without mistakes! I have had kalbee/chicken katsu/unagi don/rainbow rolls here. They are all very delicious. I work on the Strip and I usually place my order when I leave work. I will pick up my food on my way home. Portions are large and I usually have leftover for lunch! 

Not a fancy stylish place to eat and traffic on Sahara is sometimes irritating! However, the food is what matters and for the price you paid, can't beat!!

We used to order take out from here for lunch. They have very good spicy BBQ beef. I would give them more stars but the chubby kid behind the counter always stares at me like I'm a thief for taking a couple small plastic cups of Sriracha hot sauce.
This is my favorite fast sushi place, they have very good sushi even though variety is limited its a very good place to catch some sushi for lunch or hawaain BBQ.  I visit Maui at least once a week

Really not impressed, but the food was hot when they delivered.  If you want delivery you must order a minimum $26 and fee for delivery is $5.99, one of the most expensive I have seen yet.  
The food I suppose was okay.  To be honest I have had so much better, but we didn't try any of the sushi rolls, so perhaps we were just ordering the wrong things off the menu.  The meats BBQ chicken and beef had good flavor, but to us were overly salty.  I thought the noodles were very bland...we actually threw the whole container away.  The soup was okay, if you like that sort of thing.  
I personally won't be eating here again, but I have had much worse.  It just wasn't what we were hoping for and for the price of delivery, we could honestly find better places to order from.

A friend who thought he knew "hawaiian style" food raved about this place so off we went. 

Service is okay and the space is a bit cramped.  Sushi was mediocre and plate lunch portions were small.  

There are many other places to go in town.
Great food and great service. Employees always happy to serve and help. Best Hawaiian BBQ in town. Don't let the location fool you.

This place is awesome I have been a loyal customer for over 10 years and followed them from their old location, the food is fresh, excellent, tasty and very affordable. I would rather go here than fine dining. I know I will get delicious food and fast service. I get the #27 beef and chicken,  it comes with side salad, pasta salad soup, rice and barbecue chicken and beef marinated with delicious sauces and cabbage..yum! I know it is not a fine dining atmosphere, the inside is ok, but it is clean, great food and affordable and they are nice people. You won't be disappointed if you dine in its nice but there are not many tables so it fills up, there is a lot of take out. We usually get take out and go home and watch a movie. Perfect night out, we drive from summerlin, 20 min. To go here!

Took my elderly parents to eat here last week. Feel really bad because these people tried poisoning us somehow. We all left with bad hurting tummys and Top it off the worker put our plates on the floor in the kitchen. Screaming Dirty dining shutdown

Wow I was very impressed the service was on point the food was tasty and the price was right!  I could tell fresh meat and veggies were used which makes a world of difference.  Like I said previously the price was right  can't wait to enjoy this restaurant again.

GREAT FOOD!! Huge portions and reasonably priced. It's a small hole in the wall but that's how you know it's good. Friendly staff. I suggest trying the avocado mango salad with chicken & Maui rose chicken is awesome!

My fiance suggested this place after seeing it a few weeks earlier. We wanted something that tasted home cooked and wasnt too heavy. This was our first surprise. It was just what we wanted and the price was reasonable too! I had the BBQ chicken and short ribs with rice, some macaroni salad, soup and a house salad. It all was tasty, fresh, and filling. We ate around 4pm and I didnt eat again until the next day. Definitely try this place especially if you like japanese/hawiian/korean food all rolled into one. I will definitely be coming back for more. The space is small and we sat at a corner table and felt a little cramped but the service was friendly and fast and the food was fresh. I did think the macaroni salad was a little bland but with a sprinkle of a little salt and pepper it was ok. The chicken was alittle salty but I mixed it with the rice and cabbage and it was really good. Definite try.

Went here for lunch yesterday. I had the small combo with chicken katsu and short ribs. For $7.03 including tax I can't complain. I would note that I think that the ribs could have been meatier but was glad that the combo came with miso soup which I didn't realize. Also, came with a small scoop of rice, macaroni salad and two pieces of a california roll. Flavor was good and from the employees and patrons it seemed authentic. 

They had a unagi and avacado bowl I would go back and try. However, as Hawaiian food goes I have had better - although this isn't a bad choice if you are in the area and craving some cheap Hawaiian food.

Delicious food and great value for money. We had the BBQ chicken and Bento Special with ribs which were both great. The location seems a bit unlikely but don't be put off. Also the service is quick. It is very informal though which was just what we wanted with our kids but not good for a glamorous dinner!

I order lunch from this place once or twice a week; the food is always super delicious and flavorful, the employees are extremely polite& prompt, and the location itself is quaint& nicely decorated. 

I get something different every time I go, so I've had about half the items on the menu and everything is on point! Love it here!

Love their food & service. Their chicken katsu, kalbi, sushi, salmon and on and on, the best teriyaki in Vegas!! I noticed that they don't even charge a delievery fee when I ordered. I guarantee you that you will find yourself going back to this hole in the wall hawaiian bbq every week once you try!

We pick up and have food delivered to work all the time. Their food is amazing! We are never disappointed! The price is right and their service is friendly and fast. You can't beat the BBQ Chicken Special and the Bento Boxes. Lots of good quality food at a great price. Their rolls are excellent too! You don't expect this kind of food from such a small place but they do it and they do it very well.
Driving through Vegas and found this place.   Food was great, small but clean space for dinning and excellent service.
Great service and amazing food. Extremely affordable. I have gone here more times than I should admit since I've started working next door to them. I would recommend this place to family and friends.
Good Hawaiian bbq. Kalbi was tasty and full of flavor. Combos come with a lot of food, so its enough to share with another person. Would definitely return and recommend to others.
Ordered the chicken teriyaki bowl and it was amazing ! I highly recommend anyone who hasn't already been there to try it out ! I will definitely be back with my family and girlfriend !
Very good, decent portions, and definitely affordable!!!  Everything we had was good.  BBQ Chx, short ribs, dragon roll, salad, miso, rice, and macaroni salad.
One of my favorite hole in the wall places to eat. Love the salmon teriyaki bento tray.
Great Hawaiian food. On the more expensive side, but dang good.

This place was really good.  I was so tired of casino food and all the people and the noise.  This place was quiet, the staff was inviting and accommodating for our party of 7.  I had Kalbi/Katsu.  Filled me up for less than $10

Good ahi poke and chicken teriyaki located 5 min from the Stratosphere. They also serve sushi and bento boxes. 

Pros:
- Chicken Teriyaki bowl ($7.95) was fairly priced. Comes with rice and the glaze was perfect.
- Seaweed Salad was plenty for $5. Fresh and definitely worth it!

Cons:
- Ahi poke ($8.95) - I'd look elsewhere, half of the plate was diced tomato and avocado. Even the picture on their huge menu showed ahi poke with a side of tomato and avocado. The sauce was good but was clearly missing sesame oil (which traditional ahi poke has). For the $9 you pay here you'd get more than half a pound of poke at Poke Express.

Overall score: 3/5 stars
Yeah food takes a lil bit longer than others places but the wait is worth it.  Food is amazing love the teriyaki chicken bowl
Good food,great price.....the only problem is communication as they barely speak any english so the orders get messed up a lot, the employees are very nice but the owner is a very angry man.

I went here yesterday to treat my family. I can honestly say it was devine. I ordered the chicken katsu bento box and I must admit it was exceptional. The entire meal was worth the price. It was only $38 dollars and we had large portions. I would recommend this place for anyone. It was a nice, small, homey space. A hidden treasure in Las Vegas. The staff was very professional and greeted us as we entered and even gave us a farewell as we left.

Pros: DELICIOUS, great selections, great prices.

Cons: long wait, small space, rude phone etiquette- that guy sounded like I disturbed his sleep. Waited 30min for one order.

This is why I love Yelp. Would never have stopped when I saw it in a strip mall but the reviews were nearly unanimous. It was truly outstanding and, in the end, the atmosphere added to the experience. Highly recommend. Wish I lived closer.

From out of town and was craving some Hawaiian. Placed my order over the phone n upon arriving, food came out straight from the kitchen. Cashier was very courteous and food was awesome. Will visit again most definitely.
Had the Mango Avocado salad! It was exceptional! Could of been bigger but it did taste great! Price was reasonable for the quality.

Food and portions are great. But their system needs improvements. There were 3 people up front and only 1 cook in the back. I've been to a lot of Hawaiian spots and this place took the longest in bringing the food out. I came in around 12pm which I understand it'll be busy since its lunch time. But they literally took an hour to have my food out. And thats just unacceptable for a fast, to-go Hawaiian spot.

Always order number 42, so delicious!! My office is nearby & we love to order for lunch sometimes multiple times a week. My manager swears by the pork (number 35 i believe) Love this little place, staff is nice as well. Definitely recommend to anyone who will listen lol

Spicy pork served with miso soup and salad I order the same thing every time I come here. Great service & quiet spot. Menu has a vast selection to different dishes and sushi. Great hole in the wall spot......
great food, local business, the food is great, they have a lot of variety, one of my favorite Hawaiian places in town A++
My favorite Hawaiian bbq place. The food is the delicious, the service quick and the best of all, it's cheap.

This place is hands down the best Hawiian BBQ in Las Vegas! Delivery service within a 2 miles radius and the amount of BOMB food for the low cost is unbeatable here in Vegas. They mastered their dishes; definitely a go to spot especially if your near by! Keep it up fellas

Great prices and great food! Its a quick stop wether you are picking up a to go order or dinning in.  I always get the chicken gyoza bowl or #42 but next time I think I'll get chicken sticks. My roommate and I go here all the time and the only disappointment is that they are not open 24/7.

They have the BEST chicken katsu! 
 It takes a lot to impress me when it comes to katsu and they passed. I tried one of the combo meals. It has (2) BBQ chicken on a stick, (4) Crispy crab Sushi roll, (6) Chicken katsu cutlets, (2) scoops of rice, and (1) scoop macaroni salad. It was amazing. Not to mention it comes with there amazing miso soup and salad with great dressing. Check it out!

Had the Korean short ribs. They were so good. I have eaten here 2 times and have not been disappointed. The price is right for the amount of food that they give you. If you're looking for a good hole in the wall Hawaiian place this is it. Maui Rose will not disappoint!

Off the strip but short drive from it.  Better tasting than expected with is always great.  Price is reasonable and food is enough to fill you up even if you're super hungry.  Simple menu and nothing fancy but the chicken dishes are good as well as the Hawaiian style noodles.  Good variety of food so a good place if you have kids.  Would try again if I'm in town.

Food is good. Store front is not cute. Needs a little love. Parking sucks. This is one of those lots where its best to park further away and walk to the restaurant. Most people who eat here order take out, so I guess the dingy decor and uninviting store front don't matter. Would I eat there again?Maybe....

If you're ever in the area, you'll notice the typical casino food choices, fast food joints and somewhat a lack of local hole in the walls. Maui Rose is at a great location because it adds to the food diversity and is a nice change to those other food options within a 3 block radius. 

Maui Rose offers the typical Hawaiian dishes, sushi and udon soups. Quality of everything isn't anything worth raving about but the prices and the portions are and prices are. They offer reasonable prices for good quantities of food. You would probably be satisfied with their selection and if you have a case of the Hawaiian munchies and you're within the area, then Maui Rose is a great place to satisfy your cravings. 

The place is pretty dinky and during a lunch hour rush, you might feel a bit claustrophobic. However, you shouldn't feel too uncomfortable waiting for your food in a somewhat confined space as the wait will go by quickly. 

I'd say 3.5 stars for Maui Rose. I'd be a fan if this place wasn't far from where I live and in terms of flavor, I've had better elsewhere.

I have driven by this location multiple times over the years and never really had an opportunity to stop and check it out.  I did not bring a lunch to work and so I pitched the idea of checking out the Maui Rose for lunch.  Fortunately, my partner was game and off we went.

After pulling into the parking lot and getting front row parking, I was immediately surprised at the tight quarters where this Hawaiian BBQ is housed.  I would imagine that a lunch rush would fill this establishment up quickly.  However, I noticed a majority of orders where being called in and consumed elsewhere.

I checked out the menu on the wall and settled on the Maui Rose House Chicken.  It came with Miso soup and a salad.  In addition to the meal I ordered up a Spam Musubi.  There was no soda fountain so I settled on a can of Coke.

While waiting the soup and salad came out prior to the meal.  When the meal arrived accompanied with rice and mac salad, I found the house chicken to be vey General Tao'ish.

All in all...it was a solid A-OK experience.

We (work crew) eat here about once every two weeks. Food is consistently great. Traditional Hawaiian food, kaluah pork is my fav, loco moco, spam musubi and also a nice selection of sushi. Everything I've tried has been really good. Reasonable prices and you get a lot of food. The people working there are always the same. Assume it's a family business. Not overly friendly. They only have a small fridge with a few drinks. Would be nice if they had a fountian drink dispenser or something. We usually walk over to mcdonalds right there in shopping center and get our drinks. Not a lot of seating so take our food to go. 
Overall the best Hawaiian place I've found in town.

This is my first time ordering from here. My coworkers rave about this place. So far- The mango in the mango/avocado salad was very fishy ( no fish ordered). I'm guessing that a sushi knife was used to cut it. Gladly, I am not allergic to fish. The Maui Rose chicken was OK. Nothing to write home about. A little overcooked. Maybe the food is better when you eat in. I may try them again...I just will be certain not to order these items ever again.

Great food at a very accessible price, staff is always friendly always on point, so much variety and as if that wasn't enough they also deliver. If you want order for lunch id suggest you to call in the order for pick-up because at lunch time it can get really busy.

Came in with higher expectations because of people's reviews and the 4 star rating. We got the chicken teriyaki/kalibi ribs and chicken katsu plate + 2 sushi rolls which was the Jessica roll and Lobster roll. Knowing Hawaiian plates, they serve a big amount of serving, but over here they serve less amount of food. Overall, I enjoyed their chicken teriyaki. But that's it. Everything wasn't really that great. Their lobster roll in the pictures looked so good but looks could be deceiving. The "lobster" they used tasted like dried squid you can get at seafood city or your local Asian market..
Food was delicious. Friendly staff. Place was kinda small, so if you come during lunch/dinner rush, you might not get a seat.

I've been here many times and I absolutely love the food! The soup I always order makes me feel better and the spam Musubi is amazing! My only problem is the people some times they can be really nice and other times there a little rude. But hey the food is great!!
Bro just eat here. Its bomb. $5 dolla make you holla Teri chicken bowl is bigger than you think. Nice portions

Although I'm giving this place 3 stars, it's because the food is good. However, for the price, although it's affordable, you don't get the amount you'd think. I just wish I was getting more than 3 strips of the galbi and more rice and chicken katsu. I was totally disappointed when I opened my food & noticed it looked like something that would feed a little kid. 

I probably won't be coming back to this establishment, but everyone should probably know how irrational their portion sizes are. 

Just because the price is right doesn't mean it's worth it. Food is good. Just feel like I'm paying too much for not enough food.

Great surprise, we were super-hungry after our flight and wanted some good local eats. Found this place from positive Yelp reviews and they were right on the money. Excellent asian comfort food, good portions and prices. Kalbi steak, chicken katsu, sushi , and spam fried rice were all hearty and delicious. Served Hawaiian plate lunch style with sides of macaroni salad and white rice. 

Space is very small, only a handful of tables. Very popular for take out as we saw a constant stream of to-go customers at lunchtime. Will definitely be coming back on our next Vegas trip.

I order take-out from them probably 3-4 times a month. The food is always good and an excellent value for what they charge. Little hole in the wall so don't expect fine dining if you eat in, but it is not a dive by any means.

Just to inform you, this place is Korean style Hawaiian food. I will be honest and say it isn't like typical Hawaiian food taste, but it is still pretty darn good. The menu is huge with many choices. I opted for a small Kalbi, katsu, shrimp crunch roll Combo Special ($7.50). It did look awesome on the photo and I loved that I came with miso soup along with Mac salad. The food took about 20min to be ready but when I opened it up I was a little disappointed about their serving size. I know I didn't get the larger size, but for the price I paid... Since it is more like fast food type Hawaiian, I put this in the same category as L&L or Aloha Kitchen, and if I were to pay this amount there, i would be getting such generous portions. Despite that, food was good, not the best I've had, and if I'm craving for non-gourmet Hawaiian style, I'll probably won't be coming back unless I'm in the area

I didn't expect to love this place, I was just looking for something quick, fresh, easy, and new (to me). This was one of the few spots in the area to fit the bill. I have a feeling I'll be there regularly.

BENTO BOXES: Good for lunch or dinner, but more fun to dine in for the presentation. Kalbi option available if you're not a teriyaki fan.
UDON: Available with shrimp tempura or plain, with various combos. Wish the broth was a bit more flavorful but the noodles are perfectly chewy, like springs for your teeth.
COMBO SPECIALS: AKA enough food for two people under $10 if you get the large. Kalbi + chicken katsu is my go-to, served with a feast of sides (rice, mac salad, 4 pieces crunch roll, soup, and salad). If you're broke til payday, this meal will last days AND be relatively healthy.
SUSHI: ~20 basic and special rolls, several with similar combinations of ingredients (like the Jessica and the Cactus). Tightly rolled with fresh fish and not too much rice. All rolls under $10, wish there were more unagi options.

They also have a bunch of apps and sides (spam musubi!), plus fried rice and tempura. Service is friendly and fast, location is more of a grab-and-go joint, as there are only four tables and they're pretty cramped. Small cooler of Hawaiian sodas and other beverages at coutner. Location is directly behind the McDonalds, difficult to see from the street.

Why doesn't any Hawaiian places serve White meat chicken? After eliminating all the chicken dishes (i think Katsu might be white, but too risky and deep fried) found myself left trying the special Hawaiian glass noodles with veggies and a side of very good sticky rice for a buck. They were good, but the only flavor came from putting soy sauce on them. Still, the veggies (mushrooms, peppers and cabbage) were very fresh and the noodles were a novelty (at least for me). For $6, the styrofoam container was full and so this was a good lunch value.

This is in a strip mall behind McDonalds, area is under construction but is open. Very tiny restaurant and it was very warm in there so we took our order to go. Food was good, my daughter is a huge katsu fan and didn't like theirs so much.  Orders are large even for the regular size.

Looks like I'm the odd man out with my review for this place. I always see Maui Rose when I'm on the way to get sushi burritos. One day on the way home from work I stopped in and placed an order to go. $18.28 got me an order of gyoza, a bulgogi plate, and 2 spam musubi. The dining room is very small and clustered. There are about 6 tables and not too much room to maneuver. Plus there are no place settings so it gives off a "we don't want you to eat here" vibe.

I only waited about 10 minutes and everything was done. The gyoza were not fresh. They were lukewarm and didn't even come with any dipping sauce. The dipping sauce is one of my favorite parts of gyoza! Total bummer. The bulgogi was okay, but not prepared how I am used to. This bulgogi had broccoli, mushrooms, bell peppers and was sitting on top of clear noodles. The flavor was okay, but I really wasn't expecting the noodles or addition of veggies. The bulgogi plate came with a scoop of white rice, a scoop of mac salad, a side salad and a cup of miso soup. The mac salad had too much mayo and was bland. I usually love mac salad so this was a bummer. The salad was just a plain salad with iceberg lettuce, but it had a very good house dressing on the side. The miso soup was just that, and the musubi was regular musubi, not bad not wonderful. They do offer a handful of sushi rolls so I might come back to try those.
The food was really good and decently priced. I got a chicken plate and everything on it was fresh and hot they weren't very friendly but they weren't rude they were just quiet
Accidentally found while driving by and will never forget. The plates are huge and cheap with great quality food.  This will be a regular lunch spot for me and my coworkers.

Ate here today for lunch with my sis in law and tell me not, being from Hawai'i and wanting local grinds we came here because it caught my eye once in passing so we decided to dine in. Dining room isn't so big, but the food is out of this world! Came in and saw the menu to our right on the wall, which is amazing over 60 options for different dishes! Anyways, we walked in and was immediately greeted, they were patient and let us look at the menu for a bit. My sister went with the Gyoza Chicken Bowl, and I with the Kalua Pork and Cabbage. I also order poke tuna on the side which, trust me I know my ahi and that was superb! The sauce was amazing, and the avocados mixed with the poke in the sauce on a bed of lettuce was just beyond words fresh and awesome! 

The food was served moments later in a big dish for the gyoza chicken bowl and the my kalua pig was on a bed of cabbage with 2 scoops rice and mac salad. We normally eat at L&L or Aloha Kitchen which honestly is just sub par, doesn't really add much flavor or any thing to that matter or its just greasy which I hate. Maui Rose was awesome because we felt full, but wanted more but didn't feel so lethargic afterwards so it went hand in hand. Overall, one of my favorite places to go so check it out!

PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!

Stopped here randomly on the way out of Vegas. My phone died and I needed a restaurant with an outlet to charge it! I'd thought I'd give it a try.
I'm so glad I stopped here!
I paid around $8 for enough food for two whole meals! I ordered a chicken tariyaki plate, and it came with rice, a salad, and soup... not to mention a crapload of chicken!!! 
Everything was DELICIOUS! The food came 5 mins after the order was put in, AND they bring it to your table! The host was very nice and polite. 
The place itself if very small, but definitely worth visiting!
You can get a combination of a few items and not have to spend so much. The food is tasty!! Fast service and friendly staff.

Maui Rose is pretty tasty. Not too much to say about the service because I got my food to go but the cashier was polite. The food was good and they give a nice portion to where you will feel satisfied with the amount and the taste. I definitely would go back.
The food was okay for Hawaiian food. I got the spicy chicken and it wasn't flavored good. But this was the closest spot for me to grab some lunch in the area.

Good place to grab a quick cheap lunch. Their udon noodle soup tasted of MSG and the tempura coating on the shrimp was disintegrated by the broth, but otherwise everything I've had from here has been yummy. I used to order take out from here all the time when I worked at another location a little further down the strip, and they were always fast and the food hot. My boyfriend and I really liked the lobster roll. I also like their mango and avocado salad- I had it with the chicken and didn't feel like it added enough to be worth the addition. The combination of mango and avocado is delicious enough in and of itself- especially with the fresh, sweet mango used here! I'll be back to try their bento special, musubi and probably the gyoza combo. It's a nice, quick option in the area for something hot and fresh that's not casino-priced. 

The dining area is indeed pretty small, but was big enough to fit a large family, myself and the delivery driver, so it's not too bad. It's not really meant to be a hang out spot, but for a yummy, expedient bite it works great!

Just a short jaunt off of Las Vegas Blvd, or I15...... is Maui Rose...   It is a small, cute, little place that is completely outmatched by its quality of food.   I ordered the number 42 which is a massive, massive serving of food.   The miso soup, crunch roll, kalbi, white rice and breaded chicken breast were a tough task to handle, but I handled....  I also had a sampling of my friends Spam Musubi - Delish!   I count the days until I get back there for lunch.   They have an awesome menu, which is cooked fresh - or definitely tastes fresh (I dont want to be doing any sort of false word of mouth advertising for them)  i was definitely satisified.
Maui Rosenis a really good place to eat. I was introduced to this place by my brother and ever since I go all the time. The food is really flavory. I definitely recommend coming here 5 out of 5 stars

Small Hawaiian restaurant tucked away in a shopping center across from Palace Station. When I say small, it really is small! They have about 4 small tables in the restaurant, so this is a good place to get take out. The food is on par with other Hawaiian places I've been to in town and they even serve sushi. You can get bento boxes that come with sushi, rice, salad and meats. You can also order rice bowls and entrees just like most other Hawaiian places and pricing is also similar as well. Although I've only been here once, I would come back and would recommend checking it out if you're in the area.

It's unfortunate that I give Maui Rose 1 star. This was originally my coworkers (Hawaiian Natives) and mine lunch time spot since it is locate so closely to UMC/Rancho Suites area. I'd have so many good things to say BUT this last visit they really showed their true colors. 

I ordered for my guests and myself since it is a relatively small place. (No official area for ordering just stand alongside tables forming a line) It was a question of what # I ordered. When the food was brought to the table. I immediately let the waiter know that we did not order the particular roll he served us - it remained untouched. However, we did order the Crunchy Shrimp roll. He quickly walked away, Idk I thought maybe to bring the correct order out? No, he came back to the table with the carbon copy/order tape telling me that I was wrong and that the mistake was mine - scolding me. RUDE! I would have gladly paid for "his mistake" but was never given the option to have the correct roll made and served. 

Making the best of things, we continued to eat but it became increasingly hot. Not being a princess, unbearably hot. I attribute this to it being such a small space and a rather majority window store front. You have to go outside to change your mind small. The 3 men that were at the counter continued to hold a conversation that was "laugh-out-loud" funny (literally) almost as if we were the "joke". Enough was enough and we ended up leaving. I will not return to Maui Rose and will take my business else where and where it will be appreciated.
Their coconut shrimp is amazing. I go here really just for the coconut shrimp and the poke. My two favorite things on the menu. Luckily we live very close so we eat here often.

Its cheap Hawaiin food, for what it is, its pretty good, so 3 stars.  Its simple, no frills food, and a ton of bang for your buck, so if you are looking to unbutton your pants and wreck a toilet on the cheap, this is the place for you.

The food here is worth the drive to get here.  (This place is tucked away in a strip mall next to a bridal store.)

What is truly spectacular about this particular Hawaiian restaurant is the sushi.  I haven't seen any other Hawaiian restaurant that also makes sushi.  

The sushi is great.  It is also affordable.  A roll is about the same size as a regular sushi place but the price is a little cheaper.  That doesn't mean there is a reduction in taste!  I absolutely love to come here for the sushi.  All of the choices are yummy.  

There weren't a lot of people in the place at the time I was there but there were a lot of employees preparing to deliver large bags of take-out.  It may be worth finding out their delivery range.

I love Maui Rose. I'm a frequent flyer here -- it's pretty convenient to be able to call ahead of time and place an order for pickup. My favorite dish is the #42 kalbi and katsu combo. It comes with macaroni salad and delicious miso soup. I have noticed the portion size has changed lately (the small has gotten smalller), which is just a little sad since I used to love the value. They have so much to offer on their menu and I am excited to explore more of it.

Love this place!! I always get the #42 which is a kalbi and chicken katsu combo! It comes with rice, mac salad, 4 pieces of sushi (Cali crunchy roll), miso soup and a salad (that comes with their AMAZING house made dressing SO GOOD) Place is super tiny so if your planning on eating there you will probably not have anywhere to sit its best to call ahead of time and pick up like I always do :)

We went here after another place was sold out of lau lau. This place is more asian-style than hawai'ian mixed plate with traditional food. 

We came with 5 people. I got the bulgogi plate, 3 people got kalua pig, and 1 got chicken teriyaki skewers. We also got tempura veggies. The people running the restaurant were very nice and very busy. 

We got salad and then miso soup. The salad was tasty but had too much dressing and the miso soup was okay, but refreshing. I got the bulgogi and it was really good. It came with macaroni salad on the side but I think it had too much mayo. The tempura was very good and crisp to perfection. I also got a hawai'ian pineapple orange drink as well. I tasted a bit of the kalua pig and it was nice, moist, and smoky. 

Only thing that could have made it even better was having haupia or malasadas. I was craving some of that.

How can anyone give this place less than 5 stars? Maui Rose's customer service is top notch they always make me feel welcome and appreciated which is more than I can say about 99% of businesses in Las Vegas. My order is always correct, and the food is beyond awesome. If you're looking for great Hawaiian BBQ/fast Korean food look no further because this place is the best.

Definitely gonna eat here whenever im in the area!

As long as these guys have been here im surprised there are only 31 reviews for this place. Hopefully another positive review will get these guys some more attention. They are kind of tucked away behind McDonalds next to David's Bridal in nice sized plaza.

As you walk in you will notice the place is bit small. What you will also notice is the giant menu that is on the wall complete with pictures and all items are individually numbered. So ordering is very simple. The only hard part is deciding what to get because you have a lot of choices.

The times that I have been here I have ordered the Chicken and Beef Combo which comes with Miso Soup, Tempura, Salad, and California Rolls. Other times I have ordered nothing but appetizers like their Spicy Tuna Roll and Soft Shell Crab. 

From this point I am firmly convinced that it doesn't matter what you order here. My assumption is that it will be awesome! Heck my wife was curious about their Udon and tried it. She loved it! 

Prices are very good for the amount of portions you get. Usually, me and my wife share a combo meal and add a side of something. That fills us up guaranteed!

Service  is awesome! It is run by nice family and every time we come here, they are very friendly!

So, if you are thinking of going to the buffet at Palace Station or McDonalds, make your way here instead. Your stomach will truly thank you later!

Reading what is happening to OJ Simpson, he must be hating life eating the exquisite culinary delight of the Lovelock correctional center cafeteria.   I wonder if those Chocolate chip cookies that Simpson hidden away, which got him a extra month in Prison was worth it?   Perhaps OJ Simpson should have made a right turn on Sahara, and ate at Maui Rose before doing his  infamous "commando" raid across the street from the Palace Station casino.    

For a few years, I heard about Maui Rose from a bunch of Hawaiian customers, and I have to say, it was more than less that liked this place, from what I heard.   Sadly I always avoided this area, because I hated the traffic on Sahara,    On this day of my visit to Maui Rose, I was in the Chinatown and forgot to put in a sports bet before the first pitch of an early Dodger game.    This was the third week of the Dodgers historic winning streak, and I didn't want to drive from Henderson to the TI sportsbook in case I won my ticket,   So I took the I-15 north, and went to Palace station.   Well I got there in time to place my bet, but I blew off lunch at Japan Curry Zen to place it.   My opu was getting empty, and the Maui Rose sign was blaring at me.   So I made my way to across the street, and ordered a mixed place of Chicken Katsu and Kalbi  

Maui Rose doesn't have the biggest dining area, and it was kind of packed during this time of the day, so I ended up taking it out.   Service was good, and I had no problem getting my order in (meaning no language problem)    It took about ten minutes to get my order, and I was out of there with my plate.    What surprised me, the chicken Katsu was good (well, how can you blow Chicken Katsu)  and the Kalbi was pretty good size, and tasted pretty good, but not the best I had in Las Vegas.   One thing for sure, this takeout lunch was very complete.   The server gave me a bowl of Miso soup, side salad, and a Macaroni salad.     I really enjoyed the dressing for the side salad, and this entire meal was only 9.50.  Yeah, it was worth the money.    

I have to give Maui Rose more of a 3.50 to 3.75 star, and rounding it up to four.   I hate their location, but if i'm in the area and have to put in a bet.  I'm going to do a  commando raid at Maui Rose, and pound some food.

During the lunch hour it's crowded - inside and in the parking lot. We had to park in the 15-minute only parking area but was told it's okay.

I had the Combo Special: BBQ Chicken, House Special Noodles, and Beef Potstickers. It was great - very tasty! Meal came with a bowl of miso soup, which was also good. Also included was a scoop of macaroni salad.

Hubby had the Bulgogi and this came with miso soup, a bowl of tossed salad, and a side of macaroni salad.

Everything was delish but I have to say that the macaroni salad was a disappointment. It was very bland and just about tasteless - nothing at all what you're used to if you come from the Hawaiian Islands. Everything else they served was just like back home!

Oh, and the portions are generous! We both could only eat 1/2 so we took the rest home for dinner!

Big portions and good taste at relatively low cost; $8 for a chicken plate. Good place to eat if you're broke from EDC or if you lost all your money at a casino :p

Ps 5 stars are reserved for fine/ high class dining, otherwise this place would be a 5

They have a large variety good service. The atmosphere is dark and small. While waiting for my order I notice more than three people come in for pick up of very, very large orders to go. Never the less the sushi I ordered was room temperature for items that should of been refrigerated and cold. I my partner and I got very sick that night and that was the only thing we ate the same of.

Small little hole in the wall off of Sahara with four or five tables and some nice staff.

Menu includes combos, some Hawaiian classics, Korean food, and sushi rolls. I recommend the $10.95 combo with kalbi, chicken katsu, mac salad, white rice, a shrimp tempura roll, and salad. It's a LOT of food, so come hungry or bring a friend to share.

Quality is not on par with Island Flavor, but there are still good eats to be found at Maui Rose. 

Parking is not easy during peak hours in this tiny little strip, especially as construction is huge there right now. Good luck finding a spot, and may the odds be ever in your favor.

This place was pretty tasty.  Prices were very reasonable and the amount of food was well worth it.  I got the #42, Kalbi, Katsu and Shrimp Roll.  The katsu did not come with any sauce and the mac salad was too overdressed (it was like eating a mouthful of mayo).  My coworker got the chicken teriyaki bowl and really liked it.  I'd definitely eat here again but make sure to check my order before I leave to make sure the sauces are in/on my food.

The place is small but a hidden gem.  Sits across from the Palace Station, right behind the McDonald's...I must have driven past this center on Sahara a thousand times before and never noticed.  The owners are Korean and as a Korean-American I can say that the Korean food items on the menu (they also serve many Hawaiian items, of course) are legit...even add kimchi to your order for an extra $1!   And, the pricing is great for the amount of food that you get.  I highly recommend this place if you need a quick Korean fix or some good Chicken Teriyaki bowl, etc.

94 items on their menu. Who's mad hungry??? Your taste buds will have a field day trying their kalbi ribs and chicken! That was so good! Am I the only one that eats the shredded cabbage under the BBQ? Well their shredded cabbage is shredded to a point it looks like noodles. Really! Long cabbage strands, and flavored with BBQ sauce aka teriyaki. Even under the rice has sauce! Yuuuuummmzzz made me eat that for sure.

I was looking at their attractive menu. All the plates look like generous portions. Peeped on my order and their picture menu doesn't lie. I had the kalbi and chicken plate which came with a side salad. Thank you thanks for not having wimpy lettuce in the salad. Was a little warm cuz of the drive home, but still had crisp!

Restaurant is on Sahara across Palace Station Casino. Some construction in the parking lot of this Plaza. But looks like the store fronts are cleaning up - good options for certain needs: David's Bridal, Friar Tux Shop, Soho burrito, Subway, Red Wing, Landry's Seafood House all sharing the plaza with Maui Rose Hawaiian BBQ.

Worth the wait.  Getcho BBQ grubbs! 4.5****

excellent food and affordable  don't get deceived by how the place looks. love everything I tried so far. I ordered # 42 which includes soup, salad, tempura sushi, tonkatsu chicken, kalbi, macaroni salad and rice. I mean that's a lot for 10$. When the guy gave it to me, I thought it wasn't my order. lol happy tummy!

I lived on Maui for awhile and haven't found very many places as good as the Hawaiian plates there. This is the one of them! Even the mayonaise in the macaroni salad reminded me of Maui. It's very small and only 6 tables but carryout is also an option. We ate there and got a seat no problem but after we sat down it started filling up (11:45am/Saturday).  The menu is posted on the wall. Lots of options. 

PROS: Kalua Pork: came on a bed of shredded cabbage with two scoops of rice and one scoop macaroni salad (just like home). $8.50

Kalbi rib/Chicken Teriyaki combo: Kalbi ribs seasoned and grilled (a little rubbery but good) and cut up chicken with teriyaki sauce, rice and macaroni salad. $9.50

Meals came with salad (great dressing) and miso soup. 

While eating I felt like I was back on Maui.

CONS: Not very many tables.

SCRUMPTOUS! I eat here several times per month since it is close to work. I like the #43, it is A LOT of food for about 10 bucks. The service is wonderful and they are extremely respectful from the moment you walk in the door to the time you leave. I also like the AV/MANGO salad w/ chicken on top. YUM!

Found this little gem during a recent road trip.  Fantastic food!  Had some delicious sushi (the rainbow roll) and the mango/avocado salad with chicken. It was so hard to choose because everything sounded great.  I wish they would open up a restaurant in our hometown -- we would be regulars!

Maui Rose is fairly priced, filled with a wide range of options, and very good at plating their entrees for the customer. The establishment itself is incredibly small! A few tables crowded in the dining area, and 2 staff members who man the front of the restaurant.

To get straight to the point, I think it's an excellent cheap eats Asian place to go to if you're craving Hawaiian/Japanese food. Remember to read everything and get the most out of your dollar! I'd eyeball the right side (bento boxes), and maybe some noodles to boot. You'll be pleasantly full and go do whatever Vegas things you need to in preparation for your next meal.

Great food . Fair prices. (Currently heavy construction going on on all the outside storefronts so may be hard to spot for first timers.)
The inside dining area is tiny  so during busy times you may have to take it to go.
Today I had the chicken plate which included rice , macaroni, soup and salad for $7.75
I usually get the chicken bento plate for $9.50 . Both excellent choices.
Friendly service. 
Only drawbacks for me are : Tiny Dining Area, and weak air conditioning ( or a thermostat that needs adjustment )
I will always come back here , but I am always ready with a back up option if the place is full.

Food is usually solid. 

Highly recommend the Maui noodles. 

Great place for lunch but gets crowded quick. 

Above average Hawaiian BBQ with a great sushi menu as well. 

3 stars due to:

Poor food packaging: Everything goes in Styrofoam and it affects the taste of the food if it sits longer than 20minutes. Not to mention the health and environmental factors. 

Inconsistent Customer Service: Changes or fixes to orders are usually handled without much emphasis on making the customer feel satisfied. 

I recently called in an order. When I showed up at the communicated time for pick up, the ticket had never been sent to the back to be prepared. After being told I had to wait another 20 minutes for my food due to this mistake, I cancelled the order. Instead of getting an apology for not having my lunch prepared when initially communicated I was told: "Ok, you can cancel your order, that's fine. Good bye".

I intentionally go out of my way to support local businesses instead of going to one of the many chain restaurants in the area. It's going to be hard to keep coming here knowing that they don't take their loyal customers seriously.

Went here for lunch the other day with my coworker. This place is tiny! Seatings are very very limited. I think they only have around 6 tables. Best to order to go. We happened to get the last table that they use to put to go food on. I had the small combo special no. 42, which came with kalbi (3 small pieces), chicken Katsu, 2 pieces of crunch roll, rice,  and a scoop of macaroni salad for $7.50. Kalbi was marinaded well and had good flavor. Chicken Katsu was so thin. Could barely see the chicken and pretty much was all breading, so meh. Crunch rolls and macaroni salad were average. They only sell canned drinks (Dr Pepper, coke, and Hawaiian sun) and bottled water for drinks. I got the Hawaiian Sun, strawberry guava flavor. They charged $1.25 a can,  which I think is quite steep as you can get 6 pack for $3 at the market. Overall, I wouldn't come back, as there are better choices for this type of Hawaiian food with similar price range. Go to mom's teriyaki on Jones and Sahara or even better, aloha specialties inside California hotel & casino.
Terrible service , called in to place a order and the guy was rude and talking shit to me. Wish I could give the them no stars

Ordered the unagi bowl. Complete let down 90% rice. It seems like they took a filet of unagi and cut in 5 thin slices. You can have a piece of sushi that's thicker than two pieces they give with this bowl. I had to order some Gyoza to help fill me up. Kimchi is tasty on the bright side.
They used to have good food. Daughter got sick after eating here.  Now notice C rating from health department.  Who knows what is going on behind the curtain.

Delicious food at a great price! The macaroni salad sometimes can have a little too much mayo for my taste buds but its still good! Great Teriyaki chicken. Close to work which is a great lunch time spot but in case your locked down they deliver!

We love this place. 8 people came and we knew how  limited the seating was, and we were fine. Fast service as always, and huge portions. The food is always hot and fresh. The wait for 8 meals was about 10 minutes which was all served together. We stayed about an hour and never felt rushed to hurry and leave since seats are VERY limited. My family and I always come back to this place!

This place was really good! Me and my boyfriend were looking for cheap foods off the strip and found out about this place! For the price you're paying it was super filling and we fell in love with the Kalbi combo plate they had! Too bomb! The service here was really awesome! Our cashier was super nice and patient with us!
Love the Bento Box - so much food, and so yummy! Very small place, hole in the wall, but good food for great prices.
I work at a Home Health Agency. We always order from Maui Rose. There Kalbi Plate it's so good!!! Especially it comes with the macaroni salad and miso soup. Great food, and great price!!

1st time checking this place out!
I ordered the Bulgogi and got my husband the Kal-bi.  Because it was my 1st time in the person behind the counter gave me a free Hawaiian Sun Lilikoi drink. Very nice! It took at 15 mins for the food to be made. I live in Aliante so I did not inspect my food until I got home. Kind of bummed because I did not get Bulgogi, but some noodle dish that was good, but not really what I had the taste for. 
I have to say the quantity on both plates was a excellent portion size. Plus, you got with your main course a green salad with a delicious dressing and miso soup. My husband really like the Kalbi short ribs and mac salad. 
This place is in a strip mall on the right hand side of the street going west on Charleston just after Rancho and kitty corner from the Palace station. There is a Landry Seafood resturant close by as well. Maui Rose is behind McDonalds.
Next time I go I will inspect my food before I leave. They had a nice selection of Korean and Japanese food Hawaiian style. Can't wait to stop on my way home to try some Bulgogi!

Great little hole in the wall that I would never have noticed if it wasn't for Yelp. Food was excellent and cheap. All the guys that work there were extremely kind, as well.

I was craving Hawaiian food, but I ended up ordering the Bulgogi because I can never pass that up when it is on a menu. They had an amazing selection of combos and traditional Hawaiian plates for under $10. They also had a great selection of sushi rolls for cheaper than you will find at any other restaurant. 

I would definitely come back here again to explore the menu more.
Small place. But wow! Such great value! First time here. They have good food at such great prices for what it is. And they are nice! I love the combos. Will be coming back again!

Let me tell you its a hit and miss sometimes the food is good other times its too salty, there mac salad was good but the chicken katsu seemed so thin and the kabi ribs were more bone then meat wasnt very satisfied.

Always a good deal! Food is fresh and delicious every time! They give more food the most Hawaiian/Korean places that I've tried. If u order bento box it comes with tempura, sushi roll, and green salad and miso soup as extras. They got the best house salad dressing too. U can't go wrong with whatever u order. If you're hungry or have to share get a bento or combo plate. The interior isn't much, it's a hole in the wall. U might be more comfortable getting it to go.

Eh, for one Hawaiian BBQ place owned by Chinese people (that are obviously not from Hawaii) this place is not too bad!

I've visited this establishment a few times but I used to go to the one on Charleston.  That one closed down a while back.  The latest incarnation is on Sahara right behind McDonald's (some friendly competition).  Maui Rose serves your standard fast food Hawaii regional fare, similar in menus you find in L&L and Aloha Kitchen.  The menu consists of favorites like chicken katsu, teriyaki chicken, kalbi short ribs, bbq pork, and teriyaki salmon.  They also have some Japanese fare like gyoza, udon, sushi, and tempura on their menu. 

I myself like Maui Rose much better than any L&L here in Las Vegas.  The menu is larger and much more varied so you get lots of choices.  One of my favorites is the Combo Special with kalbi short ribs, chicken katsu, and California Crunch Roll ($9.50).  Each combo comes with rice, mixed green salad w/house dressing, macaroni salad, and miso soup.  Pretty good amount of food for your money's worth!  Another one of the menu items I like is the Udon Combo, mine is the shrimp tempura udon with 4 pcs. vegetable tempura ($8.50).  Add a side order of their home made kim chee ($1.00) into your udon, so spicy yummy!  Great on a cold winter day.  

Now the food here isn't life changing or mind numbing, but for decent quality fast food it hits the spot.  Sometimes I just don't feel like a burger or sandwich for lunch, I want calrose rice!  This place serves that niche just nicely.  Last time I was there they were running a special on spam musubi, 99 cents each!  I bought two to share, but ended up sharing none.  Their musubi is very good!  Must be the teriyaki glaze on the spam.  

Their most popular time is lunch, and they do mostly takeout.  There is a LITTLE place in the restaurant for patrons wanting to eat in but be warned, there's not much room!  Like maybe 5-6 tables at the most.  They also do catering for parties!

Come here for a quick and tasty meal that won't set you back too much.  Just don't come here for the ambiance!

It was okay. Not what I expected. Sushi was subpar, but wouldn't expect great sushi at a Hawaiian place. The chicken katsu was VERY salty ! The sauce was distasteful. It's too bad because I love chicken katsu. The grilled chicken on a stick was pretty good. Didn't even want to try the miso soup. Overall ok. I kinda had my hopes up entering this place, but pretty disappointed in the taste of the food. Wouldn't go again, but don't regret trying it. You never know till you try!

Decided to try this place based on the reviews.  I was very disappointed by my meal.  I ordered a Loco Moco and it  was not good.  have no idea what was going on with the ground beef patty, but it was very mushy and tasted awful.  I ask for my egg over-easy and the yolk ended up being fully cooked.  On a positive note, you get a lot of food for the price and the macaroni salad was excellent. However, I don't think I will give it another try.

Really well-prepared Hawaii, Japanese, Korean, Chinese food... all good-size portions, great prices.  

I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  You really get a lot for what you pay.  I felt like I was eating upscale food in a casual eatery.  My combo plate was excellent!  The chicken katsu was light and crisp, albeit a little on the thin side.  The yakitori sticks were perfect.  The sushi was on-point.

Definitely will visit again!

I have been coming to Maui Rose for a while now.  I went alone once while on my lunch break at work.  It was some time before I went back.  I over ate and lost interest for a spell.  I ordered a chicken stick and katsu plate.  It came with a side salad, macaroni salad, rice, crunch roll, and miso soup.  I over ate big time.  All of this food could have easily been split into two meals.  At under $10 for this, not bad.  A ton of delicious food for the price.  Fast forward a year or so and I was back.  This time I brough company.  I picked up lunch for the office.  We are all hooked now.  I learned from my first experience to limit what I order.  I am surviving the gastric bomb much better these days.  I get smaller combos for $7.50 that still come with a ton of food.  It is one heck of a value.  And their side salad is amazing.  I don't know what is in the dressing but it is out of this world.  My only real complaint about Maui Rose is the miso soup.  It does not seem fresh.  More like instant soup mix poured into a big pot of hot water.  I can look past that though.

If you are looking for quality Hawaiian food in the North Strip region, check it out.  Let it be known though, the restaurant is very tiny inside.  There is limited seating and almost no place to stand in line to order or wait for your food.  In my office we usually have it delivered or we phone ahead and pick up to avoid the over crowding.
For all you Sushi, and Hawaiian Food lovers...this is another place to try. There isn't a lot of seating here, but you can always get it to go!!

Chicken teriyaki bowl, famous kimchi, spam roll and unagi bowl, to die for, ALL OF IT! !! Super great flavors, priced very well. Would definitely stop here for lunch again.  Definitely want to try a Bento , next time

The quality of the food has gone down, a ways. Went there one weekend and got the same thing- a combo, but it wasn't as good, in terms of taste and freshness- what a pity- how disappointing. There were a few other people around including a metro cop. One guy ordered a teriyaki bowl to go- maybe I'll try that next time, if we ever go again. Not too sure that we will.
great spot for quick, high quality, delicious food. Lots of sushi options along with several other Hawaiian fusion type dishes.

First time that I have ever eaten at a Hawaiian restaurant and I have to say that it was GREAT!  I had a tempura platter and it was delicious!  Prices were reasonable, as well.  I will definitely eat here again.

Right across from the Palace Station this place has quite an extensive menu!!!

To start I'm Not  a big fan of the Hawaiian's idea of BBQ-since it's mostly a bunch of chicken dishes with teriyaki sauce on them--nothing smoked,rubbed,charbroiled,grilled or put on a flame of any kind-how that's BBQ I have no idea but whatever.

I decided to try the BENTO Special with a variety of BBQ Beef,fried shrimp,california rolls and of course rice,soup and salad. $9. Not bad but defintely NOT BBQ. Thing  I hate about asain cuisine-NO real desserts and the minute you leave you're hungry again. WTF!!

It was a mix of Japanese and Hawaiian fast food.  The menu provides a large selection.  Service was fast.  The food was good.  The macaroni salad tasted too much like mayo, but overall it was good.  Thank goodness I like mayo.  The beef was very good and the chicken was prepared well.   Overall, if you need to grab a quick bite, this place not a bad choice.

Yelpers weren't kidding when they said the place is small. Luckily I went on a monday and not busy at all in the parking or in the restaurant. As you walk in the menu board stands out, easy to read, with pictures. There is so much to chose from and from different cultures so if you looking for variety this is for you. Sushi, mandoo, kalua pork, udon noodles, kalbi meat. The best bet is to get a combo or bento. Comes with miso soup, side salad, sushi and mac salad. depending which bento or combo, you can get tempura vegi and shrimp. The meat I got was chix katsu cutlet and kalbi ribs. Ribs were flavorful and tender. Chix wasn't my favorite. I prefer thick breaded chix, this was thin sliced style. The portion of each meat item was good though.

Really can't beat this place for lunch, pretty extensive Hawaiian menu with all your favorites. Usually come here for the combo plates (chicken katsu) which includes salad and tofu soup (also good) great place for the area if your looking for this type of food.
I go here often and enjoy their yummy food. No seating and takes a while to get the food. Word of advice is to call ahead and you won't get frustrated with the long wait

Love, love, love this place!!! The food is delicious! Everything I've tried has always been amazing! The bento boxes are a great size with lots of food (choice of meat or fish, soup, salad, California roll, rice and tempura). The mango avocado salad has delicious creamy dressing! The washington roll is fresh and yummy!! I especially love the Japanese style teriyaki sauce. I wish they had this place on my side of town.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. Yesterday I returned for my 3rd visit. The food is amazing! The quantity is fantastic! Prices are cheap! When I go, I order the Chicken Katsu and a side order of Vegetable Egg Roles. This totals about $12.00. The Chicken Katsu comes with rice, macaroni salad, miso soup and salad (which is to die for!). 

They offer your typical restaurant drinks: Coke, etc. along with Hawaiian Sun drinks. BIG plus!

We ordered the Poke Salad , rainbow , chicken sticks and side of salad. Service was quick and the food was good for its price which is around $8 to $9 bucks. We will definitely comeback to try their other menu items like the unagi, salmon , lobster and more.

This place is always packed with customers. It takes forever to wait for lunch to go, but I'm always willing to wait my freshly cooked lunch. In fact I call and order for pick up. They have delivery service for a low min. purchase too. I love their food. Servers are friendly and the food is very gooooood.

I came here tonight as a first timer and will be definitely coming back. The food and service was fantastic! I had the best chicken katsu I've ever had and they had so many different options to choose from. The young Asian guy was very friendly and hardworking. Shout out to him and the rest of the staff for giving us an overall great first impression! Amazing food

Man, I love this place. From the all the kalbi, shrimp and vegetable tempura, and sushi rolls I have ordered here, I have yet to come across something that I haven't loved.

As much as I love their meal options, the reason for my recent visit and this review is for their spam musubi.

I was once again given some of the best spam musubi I have had in the city. First off, they actually give you a decent cut of spam and a overall good rice to spam ratio. It was grilled perfectly with a nice amount of crispy caramelized crust. The rice was soft and moist and complemented the spam. Another good thing about the musibi here is that the sauce isn't overly sweet and there wasn't too much of it. It was a holy trinity of spam, rice, and sauce (all wrapped up in seaweed). And it is affordable. It is less than two bucks. Same price of a street taco but more filling.

I can't wait to try more of their menu, and at the very least, get some more of their awesome musubi. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a affordable and tasty lunch.
Really delicious food! The prices are reasonable and they have really big portions. The only downside is that this place is really tight.

My little sister thought this would be a great place for lunch on a Thursday afternoon. 

The place was small, quaint, but the food was very flavorful. The dishes were inexpensive and huge, especially for the price. I don't exactly remember what I ordered, but I tried everyone's food and it was all good. Also, very friendly and helpful staff. 

Definitely recommend!

The food is awesome! 

I've come here a handful of times and don't have any complaints about the flavor of any of the food...it's just right for my taste buds. However the place is very tiny and although they attempted to make some seating for dine-in guests it's almost better just to take your food to go or eat it in the car. It could be claustrophobic at times during the lunch rush. 

I usually pre-order my food on the phone so I can avoid the wait they are pretty good about making your order on time. My usual here is the lobster roll and the Philadelphia roll. But I have tried the bulgogi...Delish. Short ribs...Delish. And a handful of other sushi rolls...Delish.  The prices are decent! Not too steep and the portions are a nice size...so it's worth the money for sure! 

The guy working the counter the last time I was there was full of personality and he was kinda cute...lol but that doesn't make my review...it is seriously the quality of the food. The size of the establishment could be much much much more accommodating to dine-in patrons but I don't dine-in much so it's all good!

Love their food -  years ago they had another location on charleston and rainbow - miss that one - it use to be across the way from CSN when I was on college ! 

Anyways, I love the salmon teriyaki ! They also have lots of sushi rolls you can order , other meals, and sides ! 

I wish they had another location ! If they re vamped marketing or made some changes - they could increase business ! Amazing food but the only location in Vegas !

Maui Rose Hawaiian BBQ is the perfect place to grab a quick bite to eat without the frills.

Head up to the counter to give your order and take a seat.  Your meal should be arriving soon.

#42 Combo Special "Kalbi, Chicken Katsu Cutlet, Crunch Roll, Crispy" (Reg $9.50)  The Kalbi is pretty tasty, as I recall before too.  I remember The Husband not really liking the mac salad before, but this time he ate all of it.  

#22 Vegetable Tempura, 10 pieces "served with steamed rice & soup" ($6.50,)  Pretty decent size meal for the price you're paying.

Everything on the menu is under ten dollars, and that includes the bento boxes and combination meals. What a great deal! 

Service is efficient, and the people at the counter are nice.  It's an easy place to go, satisfies the food cravings, and doesn't break the bank.

3.5 stars
The Chicken Mango Avocado salad is amazing; the dressing is what makes the salad, the fresh mango and avocado is a nice twist to the salad.

Good quality of meats and service
Call them a head and order for pick up
They do deliver too
Sounds pretty nice :)

I didn't feel like cooking when my friend came over & I didn't wanna take my baby out during lunch time when it's probably busy. We decided to order from here... & they deliver too, so that's a plus when you want variety and not pizza lol. 

I ordered kalbi & she ordered bulgogi, both less than $10 each. Very inexpensive, considering that it also came with salad & miso soup. The entrees were very flavorful & still hot by the time it was delivered. The salad was yummy & had another dressing, that surprisingly wasn't the usual, ranch. The miso soup was just like any other, but still good also. 

We will continue to order from here because not only do they have yummy food, but also friendly service.

Maui Rose has some of the best Hawaiian food I have ever tried.  I love their loco moco and spam musubi.  I'm lucky enough to live right behind this wonderful hole in the wall, and I order here often.

Damn I have been eating alot of Hawaiian food since coming to Vegas. 

This is my top pick for Hawaiian BBQ in the Sahara area. Everything I have tried so far has been good here. 

The combo a lot of food and cheap. Co-workers told me about this and it is awesome . 

This is the place of perference for Island style food around the area.

The place is kinda small with limited seating but who cares if the food is good.

My co-workers order from this spot all the time. I absolutely love the mango avocado salad. You can opt. for chicken, salmon, or beef. I've had the salmon in the past, when I wasn't a healthy conscious eater and I have to say it tastes wayyy better with the mango & avocado, however, since learning just how much salmon is farmed & packed with harmful chemicals much like everything we eat, well, I'd opt without meat at the very least. I have to say that provided the cost of the combos, they sure give you more than you can handle. I like their bento box, packed with your choice of meat, rolls, fried tempura or vegetable & miso soup, well thats pretty freakin awesome. You will definitely get the most of your buck.
Great food. Service is fast and friendly. Price is cheap for the kind of food they sell. I come here once a week. I like it.
Food was delicious. Place is small but cozy. Good service. Very friendly. Portions were a good size and price was good too :)

Horrible Sushi! I ordered the California crunch roll it was not crunchy it was soggy it had pickled tiny bit of jalapeo in it instead of the fresh cut crunchy strips that are in everybody else's sushi I have never had a California roll this horrible not even out of a grocery store the gentleman that checked me out the young kid behind the counter was absolutely so short and rude to everyonethat came in there I felt bad for the 70-year-old man that was working hard behind the curtain because obviously he doesn't realize that that kid behind the camera is not winning them any business and they really need to step up the quality of their food there it's disgusting. I can go to Soho sushi and get five dollar sushi rolls there the absolute highest quality of best sushi I've ever had in your life there are too many restaurants here in Las Vegas to waste your time with this one.

I was staying at palace station and wanted same Hawaiian food so maui Rose was across the street. I ordered a large combo which was Korean short ribs, chicken katsu, 4 pieces of shrimp tempura sushi, miso soup and salad. It's was a decent amount of food for the price. The sushi was ok and also macaroni salad was meh. The ribs and chicken katsu was decent. I also ordered a tuna poke, the flavor was good but the portion for price was a bit small in portion. The place is a small mom and pop joint and some of the food was pretty decent and some just ok. Nothing was bad so I may return and try again.

If you come here and expect a good authentic plate lunch. This is not the place to eat. If you have no idea what a plate lunch is then your expectation wont be disappointed. You will get Korean or Japanese inspired dishes for a decent price. My musubi resembled a burrito mors then a musubi, it didn't have any sauce on it either. I tried to order a hamburger steak but they looked at me like i was speaking a foreign language.

Family owned, Hawaiian/Japanese. Great and prompt service every time. Food always taste fresh and is reasonably priced. Everything is good-great, though I'm not as into most sushi in LV so I'm probably biased in that regard. Love this place!!!

Love maui rose!!! Great food for less price. Combination of Hawaiian&Korean&Japanese!!
Awesome place!! Recommend to try this place!!
I do not know the name of the plate, one number 42 combo is big enough for two people. Also, I tried teriyaki chicken bowl, it was one of the best i evr had.
We had the spam musubi, Kahlua pork, and a combination box. All were delicious.

This place is a hidden gem! I've been coming here for years because of the amazing food, prices, and portions. I usually order the small combo special #43. It comes with chicken sticks, chicken katsu, shrimp crunch roll, scoop of rice and macaroni. The only downside is the size of the restaurant. I've been lucky enough to always find a table, I'm sure that some others aren't always as lucky.

I stopped by here to eat during edc 2014 and now moving to Vegas I literally live a streetlight away. The shrimp udon and crunch roll is a steal! The udon soup is very flavorful, the crunch roll is very tasty, and salad with their dressing is very good! Officially my to go stop before heading home!
Best. Hawaiian. Food. Ever. Hands down :-)  with prices and proportions you cannot beat either.   I. Am. Spoiled!!!!   Just wished they were open Sundays. :)

Service: Good+ (great for a small spaced order and go spot. Cashier brought our food and an extra miso for a friend that had ordered a dish that did not include it)

Food: Yasss (veggie tempura was perfect! Food was hot and fresh. Fried rice was ok nothing amazing, but the KIMCHI was fermented just right!! Did not get to try sushi)

Price: Exceptionally inexpensive (great portions for the price. 10pc veg tempura w/ rice and miso for $6.50? Yes please! Plate of bbq chicken with japchae and rice under $6? Down with that! 6pc gyoza for $3.50? Cmon)

In love with this Korean owned hawaiian restaurant!

Side note: Hidden behind the OG McDonald's in the David's Bridal plaza so a little hard to spot and small if you want to sit down, but great for catering. Found out the hard way CLOSED SUNDAYS
this place was pretty good. the Hawaiian beef was good and the service was fast and everyone was nice.

This pace is seriously a compact place with maybe three tables with a capacity to seat 8 people. The lunch time rush is the least ideal time to dine, as they have a lunch time rush. 

I came in a bit early and luckily got a table for two people. Service was a bit slow and food took a good 30 minutes to be made. I recommend you order over the phone and just do a pick up.

The combo plate was not bad. The kalbi was well seasoned, and their roll was good. The katsu was by far my least favorite item--I could have skipped it.

The egg roll- tastes like the frozen kind sold at Panda Express. I've just generally disliked veggie egg rolls. 

Calamari- of course, these are frozen. It wasn't too bad if you're desperately in the mood.
My favorite restaurant. So yummy, and the people that work there are very kind.

So happy to find a quick casual spot with good prices, great variety, huge portions, and healthy options close to the strip. A great break from fast food or pricier diners.

Great service. Not a super beautiful dining environment but that was not important to me

The food was average. I expected better. Friendly staff. Small busy eating area. Tables too close together. It's in a strip mall and feels like a place to have lunch but not a fancy dining experience.

we order alot of to go from there and the last few times it was late.  One time over a half hour and last time 10 minutes and we gave them well over two hours.  we ordered a spam musubi and it was so not done right wish i could show a picture.  kim chee fried rice we got fried rice with kim chee on the side.  chicken katsu was dry.  crunch roll had no crunch.  We use to love this place it was close to work and we all would order.  They must have changed cooks or managers or owners or something not the same quality as before..too bad

The fried rice and sushi were great. But i think it's worth noting that there are several items on the sushi menu that have essential the same thing in them. I was confused on what to choose because i didn't really see a difference between some. I really liked the fried rice but was full very quick. I saved it for later, but I didn't even get to finish it because the heat caused bacteria to grow rapidly. 

The people working seemed very friendly, and Id come back and try more things on their menu when i come back to vegas.

Visited this spot based on reviews and were not disappointed. We had: Hawaiian chicken, beef and chicken teriyaki combos, and the veg. Glass noodles-can't remember what they call them here. Everything ordered was delicious - except the miso, which was meh. Fair variety of Korean, Hawaiian, and Japanese dishes here but service was spotty. I would say 3-4 of the guys and the older lady were snotty and/or ignored guests - no friendly greetings, thank yous, or desire to please customers here - only one guy smiled and thanked us and we brought approx 15 people here at a time when they were not at all busy. Seemed like very unhappy people. Food is a four, service is a two. Prices a three. From reading the reviews I would say your experience depends on who is working. To say service is not their strong suit would be an understatement. The 1 star review I read about the wrong order and how they felt the staff were laughing at them is believable to me as that's the vibe they gave me.

Came here with higher expectation because they have 4 stars review. We ordered BBQ short ribs and chicken katsu. Both of theme were tasteless. Lobster roll is more like crawfish rolls. I didn't like it either. 

Wish to love this place.
